keywords_explanation_array: "The colorless watery fluid that contains no blood cells.","Blood cells that contain oxygen-carrying pigment, hemoglobin.","A pigment in red blood cells that transports oxygen.","White blood cell with granules in cytoplasm.","White blood cell without granules in the cytoplasm.","Blood cells essential for blood clotting.","Also called white blood cells, these cells of immune system are involved in defending the body against diseases. ","A leukocyte with granules stained by basic stains.","A phagocyte with granules stained by neutral stains.","A leukocyte with granules that stain with eosin.","A type of white blood cells formed in the lymphoid tissues. It is important for the production of antibodies.","White blood cells that ingest bacteria.","A lymphocyte developed in the thymus. It regulates the immune response.","A lymphocyte that secretes immunoglobulin to inactivate antigens."
